Name: Agents
Description: Agentic AI systems that plan and act using tools to perform multi-step analysis, including EO workflows.

Name: Apache Sedona
Description: Distributed spatial computing for Spark/Flink with spatial SQL and analytics.

Name: Cloud Native Geospatial
Description: Community practice of cloud-first geospatial data access and open collaboration on formats.

Name: COG
Description: Cloud Optimized GeoTIFF standard/layout enabling HTTP range requests and partial reads.

Name: COPC
Description: Cloud Optimized Point Cloud format enabling range-readable access to point clouds.

Name: dask
Description: Parallel and distributed computing framework for scaling Python analytics; commonly paired with Xarray for EO workloads.

Name: duckdb
Description: Embedded analytical SQL engine used for fast local analytics; often used with Parquet/GeoParquet in geo pipelines.

Name: DuckDB Spatial Extension
Description: Spatial types and functions for DuckDB (GEOMETRY, indexes, spatial SQL).

Name: Earth Co-pilot
Description: AI-powered geospatial application that allows exploration and visualization of Earth science data using natural-language queries.

Name: Earth on AWS
Description: Program and registry for discovering open geospatial datasets hosted on AWS.

Name: fiboa
Description: Open schema/specification for interoperable agricultural field boundary datasets.

Name: Fine-tuning
Description: Technique to adapt foundation/LLM/VLM models to domain-specific geospatial tasks and labels.

Name: Flatgeobuf
Description: Streamable binary vector format optimized for fast access (including over HTTP).

Name: gdal
Description: Foundational geospatial I/O and processing library for raster and vector formats; underpins many EO and GIS tools.
Tags: ["Core Library", "Data management", "Geocoding and georeferencing", "Remote sensing analysis"]

Name: Generative AI Agents
Description: Agent pattern where an LLM selects tools (search, tiling, analytics) to answer geo questions end-to-end.

Name: GeoAI
Description: Geospatial AI: applying AI/ML methods to spatial and Earth observation data for feature extraction, prediction, and decision support.

Name: Geopandas
Description: Python GeoDataFrame library extending pandas for vector geospatial operations and analysis.

Name: GeoParquet
Description: OGC-aligned encoding for storing vector geometries in Apache Parquet with interoperable metadata and types.

Name: geos
Description: Computational geometry engine implementing robust 2D spatial predicates and operations; foundation for many vector tools.

Name: geoserver
Description: Open-source geospatial server for publishing data via OGC services (e.g., WMS/WFS/WCS).

Name: Geospatial API
Description: OGC API family for modern interoperable geospatial web APIs using REST and OpenAPI.

Name: Geospatial ChatGPT interface
Description: Natural-language interface over EO catalogs for discovery and querying by text and context.

Name: Geospatial Foundation Models & Vision Transformers
Description: Large pretrained EO/remote-sensing models (often ViT-based) that learn transferable representations for multiple EO tasks.

Name: Geospatial Vector Embeddings
Description: Vector representations of EO imagery/locations enabling similarity search and retrieval-driven analytics.

Name: Geospatial vision-language models
Description: Models aligning imagery and text/location signals for multimodal retrieval and geolocation tasks.

Name: GeoZarr
Description: Geospatial conventions for storing multidimensional georeferenced grids using Zarr; defines metadata patterns for EO data cubes.

Name: h3
Description: Hierarchical hexagonal global grid system for spatial indexing and aggregation.

Name: H3.js
Description: Hexagonal hierarchical geospatial index (JS) for fast gridding, joins, and aggregation.

Name: hdf5
Description: Scientific data model and file format for storing large array-based datasets; common in EO archives.

Name: huggingface
Description: Open ML platform and ecosystem for model/dataset sharing and tooling (e.g., Transformers) used in EO ML.

Name: Hyperspectral
Description: EO data modality with many contiguous spectral bands enabling material/biophysical inference beyond multispectral imagery.

Name: Kepler
Description: Interactive web tool for visual exploration of large geospatial datasets.

Name: Langchain
Description: Framework for building LLM apps/agents that orchestrate tools and data sources (incl. geo tooling).

Name: Leaflet
Description: Lightweight open-source JavaScript library for interactive web maps.

Name: Lidar
Description: Laser-based active remote sensing producing 3D point clouds used for terrain, canopy, and infrastructure modeling.

Name: mapbox-gl-js
Description: WebGL vector map renderer; Mapbox GL JS v2+ is under a proprietary license (MapLibre is the fully open alternative).

Name: maplibre js
Description: Open-source WebGL map renderer for vector tiles and interactive mapping in the browser.

Name: matplotlib - carta
Description: Python plotting library commonly used with cartography tooling (e.g., Cartopy) for map projections and EO visualisations.

Name: Multi-sensor Geospatial Foundation Models
Description: Foundation models trained across sensors/modalities for transferable EO representations.

Name: Natural-language geocoding
Description: OSS technique/library converting natural-language area descriptions into geometries by composing spatial operations.

Name: netcdf
Description: Self-describing scientific data format and libraries for array-oriented geoscience data; common for EO/climate gridded products.

Name: NiSAR
Description: NASAâ€“ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar mission providing global L- and S-band SAR observations for surface change, hazards, ice, and biomass studies.

Name: Open Source Large Language Models (LLMs)
Description: Open(-weights) LLM ecosystem and benchmarks used as the base for GeoAI workflows.

Name: open street map
Description: Open, community-maintained global map dataset used for basemaps, validation, and training labels.

Name: OpenDroneMap
Description: Open photogrammetry toolkit producing orthos, DEMs, and point clouds from drone imagery.

Name: openEO
Description: Open API specification for EO processing across interoperable backends.

Name: openlayers
Description: Open-source JavaScript mapping library for dynamic maps with raster and vector layers.

Name: OpenStreetMap for Foundation Model Training
Description: Using OSM as open labels/ground truth for training and evaluating geospatial ML models.

Name: OS-Climate
Description: Open tooling for physical climate risk analysis, often driven by geospatial hazards/exposure.

Name: OSGeo/PROJ
Description: Coordinate reference system and cartographic projections library used across geospatial stacks.

Name: osmbuildings
Description: WebGL visualization library focused on displaying 3D buildings sourced from OpenStreetMap data.

Name: OSPD WORKFLOWS
Description: OGC Open Science Persistent Demonstrator effort to standardize description, sharing, and reuse of reproducible Earth science workflows.

Name: Overture Maps Foundation
Description: Free and open map data releases and schemas for building map services and analytics.

Name: Pangeo
Description: Community and ecosystem enabling open, reproducible, scalable geoscience and EO analysis (often using Xarray/Dask/Zarr).

Name: pdal
Description: Point cloud processing and translation library with pipeline-based filters; core for LiDAR and 3D workflows.

Name: PLACE
Description: Mapping data trust focused on public access and contribution to open mapping/geospatial data.

Name: Planetary Computer
Description: Open-access geospatial data catalogued with STAC and served via STAC API and tiling.

Name: PMTiles
Description: Single-file archive format for hosting map tiles on static/object storage.

Name: postgis
Description: Spatial extension for PostgreSQL providing geometry types, spatial indexes, and SQL functions.

Name: PySAL
Description: Spatial statistics and econometrics toolkit for geospatial data science.

Name: QGIS
Description: Open-source desktop GIS for viewing, editing, analysis, and cartographic production across raster/vector workflows.

Name: Raster Vision
Description: Framework for training CV models on satellite/aerial imagery (detection, segmentation).

Name: scikitlearn image
Description: Classic image ML pipeline tooling: scikit-image for image features/processing, often paired with scikit-learn for ML models.

Name: Segment Anything Model (SAM)
Description: General-purpose segmentation model used for assisted labeling/segmentation of imagery (incl. EO).

Name: shapely
Description: Pythonic geometry operations built on GEOS; widely used in EO/GIS vector pipelines.

Name: Source Cooperative
Description: Data publishing utility for hosting and distributing datasets at scale (often on cloud object storage).

Name: SOZip
Description: Seek-optimized ZIP profile enabling random access to files inside large ZIP archives.

Name: stac
Description: SpatioTemporal Asset Catalog specification for describing and discovering geospatial/EO assets via interoperable JSON metadata.

Name: STAC GeoParquet
Description: Tooling and conventions to package STAC Items as GeoParquet for bulk analytics access.

Name: STAPI
Description: STAC API specification for standardized search and access endpoints over STAC catalogs.

Name: tesseract
Description: Open-source OCR engine for extracting text from scanned documents and imagery.

Name: tiledb
Description: Storage engine for dense/sparse multidimensional arrays, suitable for large EO rasters and analytical grids.

Name: titiler
Description: FastAPI-based dynamic tile server toolkit for serving EO rasters (COGs, STAC items, mosaics) as map tiles.

Name: torchgeo
Description: PyTorch domain library providing geospatial/remote-sensing datasets, samplers, transforms, and pretrained models.

Name: Transitland
Description: Open registry/catalog of transit feeds and operators (DMFR JSON) for mobility analytics.

Name: Virtualizarr
Description: Creates 'virtual' Zarr datasets over archival formats (e.g., netCDF/HDF), enabling cloud-friendly access without copying data.

Name: Xarray
Description: Labelled N-dimensional arrays/datasets for gridded EO and climate data cubes and spatiotemporal analysis.

Name: xddgs
Description: Xarray extension for Discrete Global Grid Systems (DGGS), enabling resampling and analytics on global grid indexes.

Name: Zarr
Description: Open specification and ecosystem for chunked N-dimensional arrays, enabling scalable cloud/object-storage workflows.
